ProcedureHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: PROC GEOCODE <option(s)>; 
    
Geocoding is the process of adding geographic coordinates (latitude and longitude values) 
to an address. 

The coordinates typically represent the center of a ZIP code, a city, an address, or any 
geographic region. After geocoding, the coordinates can be used to display a point on a map 
or to calculate distances. Geocoding also enables you to add attributes values such as census 
blocks to an address.

The GEOCODE procedure requires two SAS data sets:

  o An input address data set that contains a variable relating to specific geographic locations. 
    For example, mailing address variables such as ZIP codes and cities, or custom geographic 
    variables such as sales regions. 

  o A lookup data set that associates geographic coordinates with the geocoding variables in the 
    input data set. By default, the SASHELP.ZIPCODE data set is used when you perform ZIP code or 
    city geocoding. When you perform ZIP+4 geocoding, you must specify an alternate lookup data set.

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: DATA= address-data-set] 
      
Specifies the SAS data set that contains address observations that you want to geocode. 
If you do not specify this option, then the most recently created SAS data set is used.
Specifies the ZIP code geocoding method.
Specifies the PLUS4 geocoding method.
Specifies the CITY geocoding method.
Specifies the RANGE geocoding method.
Specifies the CUSTOM geocoding method.

[Valid for these geocoding methods: ZIP, CITY]
      
[Syntax: ADDRESSCITYVAR= character-variable] 
      
 Specifies the character variable in the input address data set that contains 
 the city names.

[Valid for the PLUS4 geocoding method] 
      
[Syntax: ADDRESSPLUS4VAR= variable] 
      
Specifies the variable in the input address data set that contains ZIP+4 extensions.

[Valid for these geocoding methods: ZIP, CITY]
      
[Syntax: ADDRESSSTATEVAR= character-variable] 

Specifies the character variable in the input address data set. This variable 
contains the two-character postal abbreviation for state (for example, NY).

[Valid for these geocoding methods: RANGE, CUSTOM]
      
[Syntax: ADDRESSVAR= variable] 
      
Specifies the variable in the address data set that contains non-address input values 
for CUSTOM and RANGE geocoding.

[Valid for these geocoding methods: ZIP, PLUS4]
      
[Syntax: ADDRESSZIPVAR= variable] 

Specifies the variable in the input address data set that contains the 5-digit 
ZIP code values.

[Valid for all geocoding methods]
      
[Syntax: ATTRIBUTEVAR= (variable-1, variable-2, ...variable-n)] 
      
Lists non-geocoding variables in the lookup data set that are to be added to the 
output data set.

[Valid for the RANGE geocoding method]
      
[Syntax: BEGINRANGEVAR= variable] 
      
Specifies the numeric variable in the your range data set that contains the beginning 
IP address for each range of addresses.

[Valid for the PLUS4 geocoding method]
      
[Syntax: ENDRANGEVAR= variable] 
      
Specifies the numeric variable in the your range data set that contains the ending IP 
address for each range of addresses.

[Valid for these geocoding methods: RANGE, CUSTOM]
      
[Syntax: LOOKUP= lookup-data-set] 

Specifies a SAS data set that associates coordinates with addresses.

[Valid for these geocoding methods: ZIP, CITY]
      
[Syntax: LOOKUPCITYVAR= character-variable] 

Specifies the character variable in the lookup data set that contain the city names.

[Valid for the RANGE geocoding method]
      
[Syntax: LOOKUPKEYVAR= variable] 

Specifies the key variable for the lookup data set.

[Valid for the PLUS4 geocoding method]
      
[Syntax: LOOKUPPLUS4VAR= variable] 

Specifies the variable in the lookup address data set that contains ZIP+4 extensions.

[Valid for these geocoding methods: ZIP, CITY]
      
[Syntax: LOOKUPSTATEVAR= character-variable] 
      
Specifies the character variable in the lookup data set that contains the two-character 
postal abbreviation for state.

[Valid for the CUSTOM geocoding method]
      
[Syntax: LOOKUPVAR= variable] 
      
Specifies the variable in the lookup data set that contains non-address values. 
The variable can be character or numeric.

[Valid for these geocoding methods: ZIP, CITY, PLUS4] 
      
[Syntax: LOOKUPXVAR= numeric-variable] 

Specifies the numeric variable in the lookup data set that contains the longitude 
of the geocoding location.

[Valid for these geocoding methods: ZIP, CITY, PLUS4] 
      
[Syntax: LOOKUPYVAR= numeric-variable] 
      
Specifies the numeric variable in the lookup data set that contains the latitude of the 
geocoding location.

[Valid for these geocoding methods: ZIP, PLUS4] 
      
[Syntax: LOOKUPZIPVAR= variable] 

Specifies the variable in the lookup data set that contains the five-digit ZIP code values. 
The variable can be either character or numeric, but it must be the same type as ZIP code variable 
in the input address data set(ADDRESSZIPVAR=).

[Interaction: Cannot be used with the CITY geocoding method.] 
      
Disables the secondary matching attempt by city and state if ZIP code geocoding does not 
find a match.

Disables the informational messages sent to the SAS log that tracks the progress of the 
geocoding operation. If the input data set includes 1,000 or more observations, then the 
GEOCODE procedure writes periodic messages to the SAS log showing the percentage completed 
and estimated time remaining. This option disables those messages.

Note: If you do not specify this option (because you want the status messages) and your 
input data set has 1,000 or more observations, and you are still not receiving periodic status 
messages, then check the setting of the LOGPARM system parameter. Set LOGPARM="WRITE=IMMEDIATE" 
to cause messages to be written immediately to the SAS log rather than buffered for later output.

[Interaction: Cannot be used with the ZIP geocoding method.] 
      
Disables the secondary matching attempt by ZIP code when PLUS4 geocoding does 
not find a match.

[Syntax: OUT= output-data-set] 
      
Specifies a data set for the geocoded addresses.

[Syntax: RANGEDATA= data-set] 
      
Specifies a data set that associates ranges of IP addresses with locations.

Specifies that the values of the ADDRESSVAR= variable are in decimal form. By default, the 
IP addresses in the ADDRESSVAR= variable are in dotted quad notation. For example, the IP 
address 192.168.0.1 is represented as 3232235521 in decimal form.

[Valid for the RANGE geocoding method] 
      
[Syntax: RANGEKEYVAR= variable] 
      
Specifies the key variable for the lookup data set.
